features.name: Rage
features.description:
You can imbue yourself with a primal power called Rage, a force that grants you extraordinary might and resilience. You can enter it as a Bonus Action if you aren't wearing Heavy armor.

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level: 2 (1st level), 3 (3rd), 4 (6th), 5 (12th), 6 (17th). You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

While active, your Rage follows these rules:
- Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.
- Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength — with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike — and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage: +2 (1st level), +3 (9th), +4 (16th).
- Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
- No Concentration or Spells. You can't maintain Concentration, and you can't cast spells.
- Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend it by: making an attack roll against an enemy, forcing an enemy to make a saving throw, or taking a Bonus Action to extend your Rage. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

features.name: Unarmored Defense
features.description: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change the weapons you chose. When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons: 4th level (3 weapons), 10th level (4 weapons).

features.name: Reckless Attack
features.description: You can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with increased ferocity. When you make your first attack roll on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you Advantage on attack rolls using Strength until the start of your next turn, but attack rolls against you have Advantage during that time.

features.name: Danger Sense
features.description: You gain an uncanny sense of when things aren't as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge perils. You have Advantage on Dexterity saving throws unless you have the Incapacitated condition.

features.name: Barbarian Subclass
features.description: You gain a Barbarian subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Barbarian levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Barbarian level or lower.

features.name: Primal Knowledge
features.description: You gain proficiency in another skill of your choice from the list available to Barbarians at level 1. In addition, while your Rage is active, you can channel primal power when you attempt certain tasks; whenever you make an ability check using one of the following skills, you can make it as a Strength check even if it normally uses a different ability: Acrobatics, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, or Survival.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian levels 8, 12, and 16.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Fast Movement
features.description: Starting at 5th level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing Heavy armor.

features.name: Feral Instinct
features.description: Your instincts are so honed that you have Advantage on Initiative rolls.

features.name: Instinctive Pounce
features.description: At 7th level, as part of the Bonus Action you take to enter your Rage, you can move up to half your Speed.

features.name: Brutal Strike
features.description:
If you use Reckless Attack, you can forgo any Advantage on one Strength-based attack roll of your choice on your turn. The chosen attack roll mustn't have Disadvantage. If the chosen attack roll hits, the target takes an extra 1d10 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon or Unarmed Strike, and you can cause one Brutal Strike effect of your choice. You have the following effect options.

Forceful Blow. The target is pushed 15 feet straight away from you. You can then move up to half your Speed straight toward the target without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Hamstring Blow. The target's Speed is reduced by 15 feet until the start of your next turn. A target can be affected by only one Hamstring Blow at a time — the most recent one.

features.name: Relentless Rage
features.description: Starting at 11th level, your Rage can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds. If you drop to 0 Hit Points while you're raging and don't die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you instead drop to a number of Hit Points equal to twice your Barbarian level. Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a Short or Long Rest, the DC resets to 10.

features.name: Improved Brutal Strike
features.description:
You have honed new ways to attack furiously. The following effects are now among your Brutal Strike options.

Staggering Blow. The target has Disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes, and it can't make Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

Sundering Blow. Before the start of your next turn, the next attack roll made by another creature against the target gains a +5 bonus to the roll. An attack roll can gain only one Sundering Blow bonus.

features.name: Persistent Rage
features.description: When you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended uses of Rage. After you regain uses of Rage in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest. In addition, your Rage is so fierce that it now lasts for 10 minutes without you needing to do anything to extend it from round to round. Your Rage ends early if you have the Unconscious condition (not just the Incapacitated condition) or don Heavy armor.

features.name: Improved Brutal Strike
features.description: The extra damage of your Brutal Strike increases to 2d10. In addition, you can use two different Brutal Strike effects whenever you use your Brutal Strike feature.

features.name: Indomitable Might
features.description: If your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw is less than your Strength score, you can use that score in place of the total.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 19th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Primal Champion
features.description: At 20th level, you embody the power of the wilds. Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 25.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You have learned to untangle and reshape the fabric of reality in harmony with your wishes and music. Your spells are part of your vast repertoire, magic that you can tune to different situations. You use Charisma as your spellcasting ability.

features.name: Bardic Inspiration
features.description: You can supernaturally inspire others through words, music, or dance. As a Bonus Action, you can inspire another creature within 60 feet of you who can see or hear you. That creature gains one of your Bardic Inspiration dice, a d6. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration die at a time. Once within the next hour, when the creature fails a D20 Test, it can roll the Bardic Inspiration die and add the number rolled to the d20, potentially turning the failure into a success. The die is expended when rolled. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest. The die changes at certain Bard levels: d8 at 5th, d10 at 10th, d12 at 15th.

features.name: Jack of All Trades
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

features.name: Expertise
features.description: You gain Expertise in two of your skill proficiencies of your choice. You gain Expertise in two more of your skill proficiencies of your choice at Bard level 9.

features.name: Bard Subclass
features.description: You gain a Bard subclass of your choice. Your subclass grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th and 14th level.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, and 16th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 (max 20). Alternatively, you can choose a feat.

features.name: Font of Inspiration
features.description: You now regain all of your expended uses of Bardic Inspiration when you finish a Short or Long Rest. In addition, you can expend a spell slot (no action required) to regain one expended use of Bardic Inspiration.

features.name: Countercharm
features.description: At 7th level, you gain the ability to use words of power to disrupt mind-influencing effects. If you or a creature within 30 feet of you fails a saving throw against an effect that applies the Charmed or Frightened condition, you can use your Reaction to grant the creature a reroll with Advantage.

features.name: Expertise
features.description: You gain Expertise in two more of your skill proficiencies of your choice.

features.name: Magical Secrets
features.description: You have plundered magical knowledge from a wide spectrum of disciplines. Whenever you reach a Bard level (including this one) and the number of your Prepared Spells increases, you can choose any of your new prepared spells from the Bard, Cleric, Druid, and Wizard spell lists, and the chosen spells count as Bard spells for you. In addition, whenever you replace a spell prepared for this class, you can replace it with a spell from those lists.

features.name: Superior Inspiration
features.description: When you roll Initiative, you regain expended uses of Bardic Inspiration until you have two if you have fewer than two.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 19th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Words of Creation
features.description: You have mastered two of the Words of Creation: the words of life and death. You therefore always have Power Word Heal and Power Word Kill prepared. When you cast either spell, you can target a second creature with it if that creature is within 10 feet of the first target.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: As a conduit for divine power, you can cast Cleric spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Cleric spells. You prepare the list of Cleric spells that are available for you to cast each day.

features.name: Divine Order
features.description: You have dedicated yourself to one of the following sacred roles of your choice: Protector (trained for battle, proficiency with Martial weapons and Heavy armor) or Thaumaturge (oriented toward the scholarly, gaining one extra cantrip from the Cleric spell list and adding your Wisdom modifier to Intelligence [Religion] checks).

features.name: Channel Divinity
features.description: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel magical effects. You start with Turn Undead and Divine Spark as Channel Divinity options, plus an additional effect determined by your subclass at 3rd level. Uses: 2 per Long Rest at 2nd level, 3 at 6th, 4 at 18th. When you use Channel Divinity, choose which effect to create. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Channel Divinity: Turn Undead
features.description: As a Magic action, you present your Holy Symbol and censure Undead creatures. Each Undead of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its save, it has the Frightened and Incapacitated conditions for 1 minute. For that duration, it tries to move as far from you as it can on its turns. This effect ends early on the creature if it takes any damage, if you have the Incapacitated condition, or if you die.

features.name: Channel Divinity: Divine Spark
features.description: As a Magic action, you point your Holy Symbol at another creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself and focus divine energy at it. Roll 1d8 and add your Wisdom modifier. You either restore Hit Points to the creature equal to that total or force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice) equal to that total. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage (round down). You roll an additional d8 when you reach Cleric levels 7 (2d8), 13 (3d8), and 18 (4d8).

features.name: Cleric Subclass
features.description: You gain a Cleric subclass of your choice. Your subclass grants you features at 3rd, 6th, and 17th level.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, and 16th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 (max 20). Alternatively, you can choose a feat.

features.name: Sear Undead
features.description: Starting at 5th level, whenever you use Turn Undead, you can roll a number of d8s equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1d8). Each Undead that fails its saving throw against Turn Undead also takes Radiant damage equal to the roll's total. This damage doesn't end the turn effect.

features.name: Blessed Strikes
features.description: At 7th level, divine power infuses you in battle. You gain one of the following options of your choice (if you get either option from a Cleric subclass in an older book, use only the option you choose for this feature). Divine Strike: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon, you can cause the target to take an extra 1d8 Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice). Potent Spellcasting: You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any Cleric cantrip.

features.name: Divine Intervention
features.description: Beginning at 10th level, you can call on your deity to intervene on your behalf. As a Magic action, choose any Cleric spell of 5th level or lower that doesn't require a Reaction to cast. As part of the same action, you cast that spell without expending a spell slot or needing Material components. You can't use this feature again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Improved Blessed Strikes
features.description: At 14th level, the option you chose for Blessed Strikes grows more powerful. Divine Strike: The extra damage increases to 2d8. Potent Spellcasting: When you cast a Cleric cantrip and deal damage to a creature with it, you can give vitality to yourself or another creature within 60 feet of yourself, granting a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to twice your Wisdom modifier.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 19th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Greater Divine Intervention
features.description: At 20th level, you can call on even more powerful divine intervention. When you use your Divine Intervention feature, you can choose Wish when you select a spell. If you do so, you can't use Divine Intervention again until you finish 2d4 Long Rests.

features.name: Druidic
features.description: You know Druidic, the secret language of druids. You can speak the language and use it to leave hidden messages. You and others who know this language automatically spot such a message. Others spot the message's presence with a successful DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) check but can't decipher it without magic. You always have the Speak with Animals spell prepared.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You have learned to cast spells through studying the mystical forces of nature. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability. You prepare the list of Druid spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the Primal spell list.

features.name: Primal Order
features.description: You have dedicated yourself to one of the following sacred roles of your choice. Magician: You know one extra cantrip from the Druid spell list. In addition, your mystical connection to nature gives you a bonus to your Initiative equal to your Wisdom modifier. Warden: Trained for battle, you gain proficiency with Martial weapons and training with Medium armor.

features.name: Wild Shape
features.description: The power of nature allows you to assume the form of an animal. As a Bonus Action, you can shape-shift into a Beast form that you have learned for this feature (see Known Forms below). You stay in that form for a number of hours equal to half your Druid level or until you use Wild Shape again, have the Incapacitated condition, or die. You can also leave the form early as a Bonus Action. Number of uses: 2 (levels 2-5), 3 (levels 6-16), 4 (levels 17-20). You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest. Known Forms: You know 4 forms at level 2, 6 at level 4, and 8 at level 8. Beast Shapes: max CR 1/4 at level 2, CR 1/2 at level 4, CR 1 at level 8 (fly speed at level 8). While in form, you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your Druid level.

features.name: Wild Companion
features.description: You can summon a nature spirit that assumes an animal form to aid you. You can expend a spell slot or a use of Wild Shape to cast the Find Familiar spell without Material components. When you cast the spell in this way, the familiar is a Fey rather than a Beast, and the familiar disappears when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Druid Subclass
features.description: You gain a Druid subclass of your choice. Your subclass grants you features at 3rd, 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, and 16th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 (max 20). Alternatively, you can choose a feat.

features.name: Wild Resurgence
features.description: Once on each of your turns, if you have no uses of Wild Shape left, you can give yourself one use by expending a spell slot (no action required). In addition, you can expend one use of Wild Shape (no action required) to give yourself a level 1 spell slot, but you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Elemental Fury
features.description: The might of the elements flows through you. You gain one of the following options of your choice. Potent Spellcasting: Add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any Druid cantrip. Primal Strike: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon or an Unarmed Strike, you can cause the target to take an extra 1d8 Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage (your choice).

features.name: Improved Elemental Fury
features.description: The option you chose for Elemental Fury grows more powerful. Potent Spellcasting: When you cast a Druid cantrip with a range of 10 feet or greater, the cantrip's range increases by 300 feet. Primal Strike: The extra damage of your Primal Strike increases to 2d8.

features.name: Beast Spells
features.description: While using Wild Shape, you can cast spells in Beast form, except any spell with a Material component that has a cost specified or that consumes its Material component.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 19th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Archdruid
features.description: You gain three benefits. Evergreen Wild Shape: Whenever you roll Initiative and have no uses of Wild Shape remaining, you regain one expended use. Nature Magician: You can expend a use of Wild Shape (no action required) to give yourself a spell slot. The spell slot's level is determined by how many uses you expend, with each use contributing 2 spell levels (for example, 1 use = level 2 slot, 2 uses = level 4 slot). The slot can be no higher than level 9 and vanishes at the end of your next Long Rest if unused. Longevity: The primal magic that you wield causes you to age more slowly. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.

features.name: Fighting Style
features.description: You gain a Fighting Style feat of your choice. Choose one: Archery (+2 to ranged attack rolls), Blind Fighting (Blindsight 10 ft.), Defense (+1 AC while wearing armor), Dueling (+2 damage with one-handed weapon), Great Weapon Fighting (reroll 1s and 2s on damage with two-handed weapons), Interception (reduce damage to nearby ally by 1d10 + PB), Protection (impose Disadvantage on attacks against allies with shield), Thrown Weapon Fighting (+2 damage with thrown weapons, draw as part of attack), Two-Weapon Fighting (add ability modifier to off-hand damage), or Unarmed Fighting (1d6/1d8 unarmed damage, 1d4 grapple damage).

features.name: Second Wind
features.description: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a Bonus Action to regain Hit Points equal to 1d10 + your Fighter level. You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest. The number of uses increases when you reach certain Fighter levels: 3 uses at 4th level, and 4 uses at 10th level.

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of three kinds of Simple or Martial weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change the weapons you chose. When you reach certain Fighter levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons: 4th level (4 weapons), 10th level (5 weapons), 16th level (6 weapons).

features.name: Action Surge
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a Short or Long Rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once per turn.

features.name: Tactical Mind
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you have a tactical acumen that allows you to push through failure. When you fail an ability check, you can expend a use of Second Wind, adding 1d10 to the roll, potentially changing a failure into a success. If the check still fails, this use of Second Wind isn't expended.

features.name: Fighter Subclass
features.description: You gain a Fighter subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Fighter levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Fighter level or lower.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 6th, 8th, 12th, 14th, and 16th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 (max 20). Alternatively, you can choose a feat.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Tactical Shift
features.description: Starting at 5th level, whenever you activate your Second Wind with a Bonus Action, you can move up to half your Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

features.name: Indomitable
features.description: If you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a bonus equal to your Fighter level. You must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a Long Rest. You can use this feature twice between Long Rests starting at 13th level and three times between Long Rests starting at 17th level.

features.name: Tactical Master
features.description: At 9th level, when you attack with a weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the Push, Sap, or Slow property for that attack.

features.name: Two Extra Attacks
features.description: At 11th level, you can attack three times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Indomitable (two uses)
features.description: You can now use Indomitable twice between Long Rests.

features.name: Studied Attacks
features.description: Starting at 13th level, you study your opponents and learn from each missed strike. If you make an attack roll against a creature and miss, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that same creature before the end of your next turn.

features.name: Action Surge (two uses)
features.description: You can now use Action Surge twice between Short or Long Rests, but only once on a turn.

features.name: Indomitable (three uses)
features.description: You can now use Indomitable three times between Long Rests.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 19th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Three Extra Attacks
features.description: At 20th level, you can attack four times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Unarmored Defense
features.description: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

features.name: Martial Arts
features.description: At 1st level, your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use Unarmed Strikes and Monk weapons. You gain benefits: use DEX instead of STR for Monk weapon attacks, roll a Martial Arts die in place of normal damage (d6 at 1st level, d8 at 5th, d10 at 11th, d12 at 17th), when you use the Attack action with an Unarmed Strike or Monk weapon, you can make one Unarmed Strike as a Bonus Action.

features.name: Monk's Focus
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, your training allows you to harness mystic energy referred to as Focus. Your access to this energy is represented by a number of Focus Points. Your Monk level determines the number of points you have (equal to your Monk level). You can spend these points to fuel various Focus features. When you spend a Focus Point, it is unavailable until you finish a Short or Long Rest, at the end of which you draw all of your expended Focus back into yourself. Some Focus features require your target to make a saving throw. The DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.

features.name: Patient Defense
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can take the Disengage action as a Bonus Action. If you spend 1 Focus Point when you take this Bonus Action, you can also take the Dodge action as part of it.

features.name: Step of the Wind
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can take the Dash action as a Bonus Action. If you spend 1 Focus Point when you take this Bonus Action, you can also take the Disengage action as part of it, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

features.name: Uncanny Metabolism
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, when you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended Focus Points. When you do so, you can also roll your Martial Arts die and regain a number of Hit Points equal to your Monk level plus the number rolled. You can use this feature once per Long Rest.

features.name: Unarmored Movement
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield. This bonus increases at higher levels: +15 ft at 6th, +20 ft at 10th, +25 ft at 14th, +30 ft at 18th.

features.name: Monk Subclass
features.description: When you reach 3rd level, you gain a Monk subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Monk levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Monk level or lower.

features.name: Deflect Attacks
features.description: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your Reaction when you are hit by an attack that deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage to reduce the damage by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Monk level. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can spend 1 Focus Point to redirect the attack. For a melee attack, choose a target within 5 feet of you. For a ranged attack, choose a target within 60 feet of you that is not behind Total Cover. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take damage equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die + your Dexterity modifier. The damage is the same type as the attack that was deflected.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, and 16th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 (max 20). Alternatively, you can choose a feat.

features.name: Slow Fall
features.description: Beginning at 4th level, you can use your Reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your Monk level.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Stunning Strike
features.description: Starting at 5th level, once per turn when you hit a creature with a Monk weapon or an Unarmed Strike, you can spend 1 Focus Point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be Stunned until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target's Speed is halved until the start of your next turn, and the next attack roll made against it before then has Advantage.

features.name: Empowered Strikes
features.description: Starting at 6th level, whenever you deal damage with your Unarmed Strike, you can deal Force damage instead of Bludgeoning damage.

features.name: Evasion
features.description: At 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. You don't benefit from this feature if you have the Incapacitated condition.

features.name: Acrobatic Movement
features.description: At 9th level, while you aren't wearing armor or wielding a Shield, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the movement.

features.name: Self-Restoration
features.description: At 10th level, at the end of each of your turns, you can end one of the following conditions on yourself (no action required): Charmed, Frightened, or Poisoned. In addition, you need neither food nor drink to survive.

features.name: Heightened Focus
features.description: At 10th level, your Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense, and Step of the Wind gain the following benefits. Flurry of Blows: You can make three Unarmed Strikes with it instead of two. Patient Defense: When you use Patient Defense, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to twice your Martial Arts die roll. Step of the Wind: When you use Step of the Wind, you can choose a willing creature within 5 feet of you that is Large or smaller. You move that creature with you until the end of your turn. The creature's movement doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks.

features.name: Deflect Energy
features.description: Starting at 13th level, you can now use your Deflect Attacks feature against any attack, including spell attacks. When you reduce the damage to 0 from a ranged attack, you can still redirect it if you spend 1 Focus Point.

features.name: Disciplined Survivor
features.description: Beginning at 14th level, your mastery of your focus grants you proficiency in all saving throws. Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 Focus Point to reroll it and take the second result.

features.name: Perfect Focus
features.description: At 15th level, when you roll Initiative and have fewer than 4 Focus Points remaining and don't use Uncanny Metabolism, you regain Focus Points until you have 4.

features.name: Superior Defense
features.description: At 18th level, at the start of your turn, you can spend 3 Focus Points to gain Resistance to all damage except Force damage. This benefit lasts until the start of your next turn or until you have the Incapacitated condition.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 19th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Body and Mind
features.description: At 20th level, your Dexterity and Wisdom scores increase by 4, to a maximum of 25.

features.name: Lay on Hands
features.description: Your blessed touch can heal wounds. As a Bonus Action, you can touch a creature (including yourself) and draw from a pool of healing power that replenishes when you take a Long Rest. You can restore a total number of Hit Points equal to your Paladin level x 5. Alternatively, you can expend 5 Hit Points from your pool to remove the Poisoned condition from the creature; those points don't also restore Hit Points.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You have learned to draw on divine magic through meditation and prayer to cast spells. Charisma is your spellcasting ability. You prepare spells from the Paladin spell list each day.

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change the weapons you chose.

features.name: Fighting Style
features.description: At 2nd level, you gain a Fighting Style feat of your choice. Choose one: Archery (+2 to ranged attack rolls), Blind Fighting (Blindsight 10 ft.), Defense (+1 AC while wearing armor), Dueling (+2 damage with one-handed weapon), Great Weapon Fighting (reroll 1s and 2s on damage with two-handed weapons), Interception (reduce damage to nearby ally by 1d10 + PB), Protection (impose Disadvantage on attacks against allies with shield), Thrown Weapon Fighting (+2 damage with thrown weapons, draw as part of attack), Two-Weapon Fighting (add ability modifier to off-hand damage), or Unarmed Fighting (1d6/1d8 unarmed damage, 1d4 grapple damage). Instead of choosing one of those feats, you can choose Blessed Warrior: learn two Cleric cantrips (CHA-based), replaceable on level up.

features.name: Paladin's Smite
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you always have the Divine Smite spell prepared. In addition, you can cast Divine Smite without expending a spell slot, but you must finish a Long Rest before you can cast it this way again.

features.name: Channel Divinity
features.description: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy. You can use Channel Divinity twice per Long Rest (three times at 11th level). Your Sacred Oath provides specific Channel Divinity options. You also gain the Divine Sense Channel Divinity option, which allows you to detect Celestials, Fiends, and Undead within 60 feet. You regain one expended use on a Short Rest and all uses on a Long Rest.

features.name: Paladin Subclass
features.description: When you reach 3rd level, you swear the oath that binds you as a Paladin forever. Your oath grants you features at 3rd, 7th, 15th, and 20th level.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, and 16th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 (max 20). Alternatively, you can choose a feat.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Faithful Steed
features.description: At 5th level, you gain the ability to call forth a noble steed. You always have the Find Steed spell prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare. You can also cast it once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Aura of Protection
features.description: Starting at 6th level, whenever you or a friendly creature within your 10-foot Emanation must make a saving throw, the creature gains a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1). You must be conscious and not Incapacitated to grant this bonus.

features.name: Restoring Touch
features.description: At 14th level, when you use your Lay on Hands, you can also end one condition on the target by expending 5 Hit Points from the healing pool per condition: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Frightened, Paralyzed, or Stunned.

features.name: Abjure Foes
features.description: At 9th level, as a Magic action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to choose a number of creatures you can see within 60 feet of you, up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. On its turn, the Frightened target can do only one of the following: move, take an action, or take a Bonus Action. The Frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

features.name: Aura of Courage
features.description: Starting at 10th level, you and your allies have Immunity to the Frightened condition while in your Aura of Protection. If a Frightened ally enters the aura, that condition has no effect on that ally while there.

features.name: Radiant Strikes
features.description: By 11th level, you are so suffused with righteous might that all your melee weapon strikes carry divine power with them. Whenever you hit a creature with a melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike, the creature takes an extra 1d8 Radiant damage.

features.name: Aura Expansion
features.description: At 18th level, the range of your Aura of Protection and Aura of Courage increases to 30 feet.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 19th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Subclass Feature
features.description: At 20th level, you gain a feature from your Sacred Oath subclass.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You have learned to channel the magical essence of nature to cast spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability. You prepare a list of Ranger spells each day, choosing from the Ranger spell list.

features.name: Favored Enemy
features.description: At 1st level, you always have the Hunter's Mark spell prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare. You can cast Hunter's Mark a number of times without expending a spell slot: twice at 1st level, three times at 5th level, four times at 9th level, five times at 13th level, and six times at 17th level. You regain all expended free uses when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change the weapons you chose.

features.name: Fighting Style
features.description: At 2nd level, you gain a Fighting Style feat of your choice (such as Archery, Defense, Dueling, or Two-Weapon Fighting). Alternatively, instead of choosing a Fighting Style feat, you can choose Druidic Warrior: you learn two Druid cantrips of your choice (Guidance and Starry Wisp are recommended). The chosen cantrips count as Ranger spells for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a Ranger level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another Druid cantrip.

features.name: Deft Explorer
features.description: Thanks to your extensive wandering, you gain the following benefits. Expertise: You have Expertise in one of your skill proficiencies of your choice. Languages: You know two languages of your choice.

features.name: Ranger Subclass
features.description: You gain a Ranger subclass of your choice. Your subclass grants you features at 3rd, 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, and 16th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 (max 20). Alternatively, you can choose a feat.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Roving
features.description: Starting at 6th level, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. You also gain a climbing speed and a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

features.name: Expertise
features.description: You gain Expertise in two of your skill proficiencies of your choice.

features.name: Tireless
features.description: Starting at 10th level, as a Bonus Action, you can give yourself a number of temporary Hit Points equal to 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest. In addition, whenever you finish a Short Rest, your Exhaustion level, if any, is decreased by 1.

features.name: Relentless Hunter
features.description: Starting at 13th level, taking damage can't break your Concentration on Hunter's Mark.

features.name: Nature's Veil
features.description: Starting at 14th level, you can use a Bonus Action to magically become Invisible, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Precise Hunter
features.description: At 17th level, you have Advantage on attack rolls against the creature currently marked by your Hunter's Mark.

features.name: Feral Senses
features.description: At 18th level, you gain Blindsight with a range of 30 feet.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 19th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Foe Slayer
features.description: At 20th level, the damage die of your Hunter's Mark is a d10 rather than a d6.

features.name: Expertise
features.description: You gain Expertise in two of your skill proficiencies of your choice. Expertise doubles your Proficiency Bonus for any ability check you make that uses a chosen proficiency.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.description: You know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack roll if you have Advantage on the roll and the attack uses a Finesse or a Ranged weapon. The extra damage's type is the same as the weapon's type. You don't need Advantage on the attack roll if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the target, the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition, and you don't have Disadvantage on the attack roll. The extra damage increases as you gain Rogue levels, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue Features table.

features.name: Thieves' Cant
features.description: You picked up various languages in the communities where you plied your roguish talents. You know Thieves' Cant and one other language of your choice.

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as Daggers and Shortbows. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose. For example, you could switch to using the mastery properties of Scimitars and Shortswords.

features.name: Cunning Action
features.description: Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. On your turn, you can take one of the following actions as a Bonus Action: Dash, Disengage, or Hide.

features.name: Rogue Subclass
features.description: You gain a Rogue subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Rogue levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Rogue level or lower.

features.name: Steady Aim
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you give yourself Advantage on your next attack roll on the current turn. You can use this feature only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use it, your Speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, and 16th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 (max 20). Alternatively, you can choose a feat.

features.name: Cunning Strike
features.description: You've developed cunning ways to use your Sneak Attack. When you deal Sneak Attack damage, you can add one of the following Cunning Strike effects. Each effect has a die cost, which is the number of Sneak Attack damage dice you must forgo to add the effect. You remove the die before rolling, and the effect occurs immediately after the attack's damage is dealt. If a Cunning Strike effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus. Poison (Cost: 1d6). You add a toxin to your strike, forcing the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the Poisoned condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the Poisoned target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. To use this effect, you must have a Poisoner's Kit on your person. Trip (Cost: 1d6). If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the Prone condition. Withdraw (Cost: 1d6). Immediately after the attack, you move up to half your Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

features.name: Uncanny Dodge
features.description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can take a Reaction to halve the attack's damage against you (round down).

features.name: Expertise
features.description: You gain Expertise in two more of your skill proficiencies of your choice.

features.name: Evasion
features.description: You can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain dangers. When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail. You can't use this feature if you have the Incapacitated condition.

features.name: Reliable Talent
features.description: Whenever you make an ability check that uses one of your skill or tool proficiencies, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

features.name: Improved Cunning Strike
features.description: You can use up to two Cunning Strike effects when you deal Sneak Attack damage, paying the die cost for each effect.

features.name: Devious Strikes
features.description: You've practiced new ways to use your Sneak Attack deviously. The following effects are now among your Cunning Strike options. Daze (Cost: 2d6). The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or on its next turn, it can do only one of the following: move or take an action or a Bonus Action. Knock Out (Cost: 6d6). The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the Unconscious condition for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. The Unconscious target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Obscure (Cost: 3d6). The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, or it has the Blinded condition until the end of its next turn.

features.name: Slippery Mind
features.description: You have acquired greater mental strength. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws and Charisma saving throws.

features.name: Elusive
features.description: You are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll can have Advantage against you unless you have the Incapacitated condition.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: You gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Stroke of Luck
features.description: You have a marvelous knack for succeeding when you need to. If you fail a D20 Test, you can turn the roll into a 20. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Short or Long Rest.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: An event in your past, or in the life of a parent or ancestor, left an indelible mark on you, infusing you with arcane magic. This font of magic, whatever its origin, fuels your spells. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Sorcerer spells.

features.name: Innate Sorcery
features.description: An event in your past left you with the ability to channel raw magical power. As a Bonus Action, you can tap into your innate sorcery for 1 minute. While active, your spell save DC increases by 1, and you have Advantage on the attack rolls of Sorcerer spells you cast. You can use this feature twice per Long Rest.

features.name: Font of Magic
features.description:
At 2nd level, you tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself, represented by Sorcery Points. Your maximum Sorcery Points equals your Sorcerer level. You regain all spent Sorcery Points when you finish a Long Rest.

Creating Spell Slots: As a Bonus Action, you can transform unexpended Sorcery Points into a spell slot: 1st level = 2 SP, 2nd level = 3 SP, 3rd level = 5 SP, 4th level = 6 SP, 5th level = 7 SP. You can't create a slot above 5th level. Any spell slot you create with this feature vanishes when you finish a Long Rest.

Converting Spell Slots: As a Bonus Action, you can expend a spell slot and gain a number of Sorcery Points equal to the slot's level.

features.name: Metamagic
features.description: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to twist your spells to suit your needs. You gain two Metamagic options of your choice. You gain two more at 10th level and two more at 17th level (total of 6). Options include: Careful Spell, Distant Spell, Empowered Spell, Extended Spell, Heightened Spell, Quickened Spell, Seeking Spell, Subtle Spell, Transmuted Spell, Twinned Spell.

features.name: Sorcerer Subclass
features.description: You gain a Sorcerer subclass of your choice. Your subclass grants you features at 3rd, 6th, 14th, and 18th level.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, and 16th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 (max 20). Alternatively, you can choose a feat.

features.name: Sorcerous Restoration
features.description: At 5th level, when you finish a Short Rest, you can regain expended Sorcery Points, but no more than a number equal to half your Sorcerer level (round down). Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Sorcery Incarnate
features.description: Starting at 7th level, while your Innate Sorcery feature is active, you can use up to two of your Metamagic options on each spell you cast. In addition, if you have no uses of Innate Sorcery left, you can use it if you spend 2 Sorcery Points when you take the Bonus Action to activate it.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 19th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Arcane Apotheosis
features.description: At 20th level, while your Innate Sorcery feature is active, you can use one Metamagic option on each of your turns without spending Sorcery Points on it.

features.name: Pact Magic
features.description: Through your patron's power and your own arcane study, you have facility with spells. You know two cantrips and can cast Warlock spells using Charisma. Unlike other casters, you have a limited number of spell slots that recharge on a Short Rest. All spell slots are the same level (equal to your Pact Magic level).

features.name: Eldritch Invocations
features.description: In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed Eldritch Invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical ability. You gain invocations as you level up: 1 at 1st level, 3 at 2nd, 5 at 5th, 6 at 7th, 7 at 9th, 8 at 12th, 9 at 15th, 10 at 18th. Pact Boons (Pact of the Blade, Pact of the Chain, Pact of the Tome) are available as invocation options. Whenever you gain a Warlock level, you can replace one of your invocations with another one for which you qualify.

features.name: Magical Cunning
features.description: At 2nd level, you can perform an esoteric rite for 1 minute to regain expended Pact Magic spell slots but no more than a number equal to half your maximum (round up). Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Warlock Subclass
features.description: At 3rd level, you gain a Warlock subclass of your choice. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, and 16th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 (max 20). Alternatively, you can choose a feat.

features.name: Contact Patron
features.description: At 9th level, you always have the Contact Other Plane spell prepared. When you cast this spell to contact your Warlock patron, you automatically succeed on the spell's saving throw.

features.name: Mystic Arcanum (6th level)
features.description: At 11th level, your patron bestows upon you a magical secret called an arcanum. Choose one 6th-level spell from the Warlock spell list as this arcanum. You can cast your arcanum spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a Long Rest before you can do so again. You gain additional arcana at higher levels: 7th-level at 13th, 8th-level at 15th, 9th-level at 17th.

features.name: Mystic Arcanum (7th level)
features.description: Choose one 7th-level Warlock spell as an additional arcanum. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a Long Rest before you can do so again.

features.name: Mystic Arcanum (8th level)
features.description: Choose one 8th-level Warlock spell as an additional arcanum. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a Long Rest before you can do so again.

features.name: Mystic Arcanum (9th level)
features.description: Choose one 9th-level Warlock spell as an additional arcanum. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a Long Rest before you can do so again.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 19th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat of your choice.

features.name: Eldritch Master
features.description: At 20th level, your Magical Cunning feature is upgraded. When you use Magical Cunning, you regain all your expended Pact Magic spell slots instead of half.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: As a student of arcane magic, you have a spellbook containing spells. Your spellbook starts with six level 1 Wizard spells of your choice. Each time you gain a Wizard level, you can add two Wizard spells of your choice to your spellbook for free. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability. You prepare the list of Wizard spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from your spellbook. The number of spells you can prepare is shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Wizard Features table. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change your list of prepared spells by studying your spellbook. You can also swap one cantrip you know for another Wizard cantrip whenever you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Arcane Recovery
features.description: You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. When you finish a Short Rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your Wizard level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Ritual Adept
features.description: You can cast any Wizard spell as a Ritual if that spell has the Ritual tag and the spell is in your spellbook. You needn't have the spell prepared. You must read from the book to cast a spell in this way.

features.name: Scholar
features.description: Choose one of the following skills in which you have proficiency: Arcana, History, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, or Religion. You have Expertise in the chosen skill.

features.name: Wizard Subclass
features.description: You gain a Wizard subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Wizard levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are unlocked by the Wizard levels specified in the subclass.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Wizard levels 8, 12, and 16.

features.name: Memorize Spell
features.description: Whenever you finish a Short Rest, you can study your spellbook and replace one of the level 1+ Wizard spells you have prepared for your Spellcasting feature with another level 1+ spell from the book.

features.name: Spell Mastery
features.description: Choose a level 1 Wizard spell and a level 2 Wizard spell that are in your spellbook. You always have those spells prepared, and you can cast each of them once at its lowest level without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a Long Rest. To cast either spell at a higher level, you must expend a spell slot as normal. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can study your spellbook and replace one of those spells with an eligible Wizard spell of the same level from the book.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. Boon of Spell Recall is recommended.

features.name: Signature Spells
features.description: Choose two level 3 Wizard spells in your spellbook as your Signature Spells. You always have these spells prepared, and you can cast each of them once at level 3 without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can't cast them in this way again until you finish a Short or Long Rest. To cast either spell at a higher level, you must expend a spell slot.
